skills.name: Solve problems that combine addition or subtraction with multiplication
Add decimals where the numbers involved have a different number of decimal places
Subtract decimals where the numbers involved have a different number of decimal places
Multiply two decimals together with a different number of decimal places
Divide two decimals with a different number of decimal places

explanations.A: Sara has one lot of £3.67 and Rhys has 2 lots of £3.67. So that gives 3 x £3.67. So 4 x £3.67 is not a suitable calculation.
explanations.B: (£3.67 x 2) tells us how much Rhys has so when we add that to Sara's £3.67, we get the total. But we want a calculation which does NOT give us the correct answer.
explanations.C: (£3.70 x 3) - £0.09 is the same as (£3.70 x 3) - (£0.03 x 3), which is also the same as £3.67 x 3. This tells us how much Rhys and Sara have altogether. But we want a calculation which does NOT give us the correct answer.
explanations.D: Sara has one lot of £3.67 and Rhys has 2 lots of £3.67. So that gives 3 x £3.67. But we want a calculation which does NOT give us the correct answer.

explanations.A: To add decimal numbers, we need to line up the decimal points and ensure that we add digits in the same place value column. To avoid confusion, 0.2 can be written as 0.20. So we do 5 + 0 = 5 in the hundredths column, 1 + 2 = 3 in the tenths column and 0 + 0 = 0 in the units column, so an overall answer of 0.35

explanations.A: I think you may have swapped the numbers round but 0.2 - 0.15 is not the same as 0.15 - 0.2. Think about a number line: start from 0.15. If we take away 0.2 where will we end up on the number line?
explanations.B: Not quite. Remember that in 0.2, the 2 represents 2 tenths, not 2 hundredths.
explanations.C: If we think of a number line and start at 0.15, we need to subtract 0.15 to get to zero on the number line. But we need to subtract 0.2 so we still need to subtract another 0.05 (because 0.2 – 0.15 = 0.05). So from 0, if we subtract another 0.05, we will be at -0.05 on the number line. So our answer is -0.05.
